answerText: search[10] Breadth-first search is used in the Edmonds-Karp algorithm for finding the max value of this property of a directed weighted graph which can be computed using the Ford-Fulkerson method. Common applications include networks of water pipes.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | Chicago A  | 19 | Science | Computer Science | College
subject: Science
question: Question: In a graph, this process can be done either depth-first or breadth-first. For 10 points each, [10] Name this common task which involves finding a desired object which can be done in O(n log n) ("big O of n log n") time for a sorted list using the binary kind.
